reviews.text: This review is long overdue.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I should stated that we had a small ceremony at Hans Fahden Vineyard in the afternoon and an intimate reception at Auberge Du Soleil in the evening.
reviews.title: Luxury second-to-none in the Napa Valley

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This review is for the hotel and resort.
reviews.title: Beautiful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: You are welcomed as you exit from your car and whisked to your room via golf cart. No welcome drink, although I believe we were offered that the first time we visited.
reviews.title: Good hotel but service not on par with world's finest hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service is great, especially our server during breakfast who remembered how we liked our coffees and teas and was genuinely friendly and attentive.
reviews.title: Amazing property, great views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: .. we enjoyed this beautiful property from the Relais & Châteaux group. The reception was very good. Our room was located on a second floor with beautiful views of the valley. It was spacious, nice and clean. A lot of amenities including a fireplace with logs. A small refrigerator with a lot of complimentary drinks, snacks etc.. The Spa treatment was good. We had a delicious dinner in the evening.
reviews.title: Even on a rainy day...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing that was not so good.. early the next morning, a group of 5-6 housekeeping employees were doing 'spring' cleaning for hours in the room on top of ours. We were annoyed with the noise. We suggest that, since it is not high season yet, perhaps they should have more coordination and do this type of cleaning when there is no guests next door.
reviews.title: Beautiful property for a romantic getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This property was on my "bucket" list of hotels since the mid-80s when I used to visit the wine country twice a month from my home in Silicon Valley. I couldn't affort it back then, so we decided to try it for a Valentine's Day getaway. We have been fortunate to stay in several nice hotels recently(like The Peninsula in Beverly Hills and The Carlyle in NYC) so I was interested to stay at Auberge to compare because Auberge is, by far, much more expensive. I had the same experience as a previous reviewer, in that the rate I was quoted on the phone was $100 more than the rate I found on the Internet, which was frustrating and unnecessary in my view. I also used the Concierge prior to my stay to book winery tours. She was very helpful and friendly and her follow-through was excellent. She also booked a couple of local restaurants, which was great but we did not have a car and had no idea it would be impossible to get a cab back to Auberge from St. Helena. One of the couples dining at the restaurant was kind enough to give us lift - make sure you have a car. We booked the cheapest room and got an upgrade at check-in. We had a terrace but could not see the Valley yet we liked the privacy. The complimentary snacks and bottle of wine in the room was a very nice touch, as was the nightly turn-down. The staff throughout the property was very friendly. The grounds are lovely; loved the sculptures and landscaping. We ate 2 dinners at the Bistro, which is more casual than the formal dining room but we much preferred it. We had reservations at the formal restaurant for Valentine's night, but sat down and saw it was a fixed-price, four course meal and we had had so much wine that we again opted for a cheese/pate platter & oysters in the Bistro. The staff at the restaurant did not make us feel at all uncomfortable about opting for the Bistro. We had very noisy neighbors two of the three nights during our stay. I mentioned it to the front desk manager our final morning and she followed up with me after we checked out and gave us a discount on our bill. I really
reviews.title: Horrible taste to the end of our trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: appreciated her taking the time and effort to address the issue even after we departed. That is an indication that Auberge cares about their guests enough to want them to return, even in a touristy area like Napa Valley. We will return, but I do feel the nightly price of this hotel is too high given the property.
reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The above heading can't summarise my first visit to a.d.s enough. Having spent an amazing stay for our anniversary and my birthday in napa with the poetry inn ( which by the way the staff at auberge bistro can clearly learn sth fr in terms of service), my partner and I decided to check out auberge in view if the supposedly excellent ratings on tripadvisor as we were planning to return to napa pretty soon.
reviews.title: Lunch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its a lovely hotel. We definitely liked it. Feels a little isolated and after spending 3 nights at the Bardessono in Yountville, this felt a bit anticlimatic. It lacked the energy that we were looking for, but its a beautiful elegant hotel, great views, nice restaurant. We preferrred the B however. We were happy we tried both.
reviews.title: Lovely but quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't even know where to start oogling about how great Auberge is! Upon arrival, you are greeted with a glass of wine. The rooms are beautiful, each having a private balcony with a beautiful view of the valley below. The mini bar is stocked with great snack items and beverages. When we arrived in our room, there was a cute little birthday cake and bottle of bubbly for my husband's birthday. This place is all about the details (we even received a thank you card via mail at home!). The staff is great, always looking for the extra thing to make your day. There is a complimentary Mercedes rental program for guests as well. We stayed during the off season while they were renovating, but we barely even noticed the work -- even with them getting a new roof! We sadly left and headed to the next relais, but Auberge was the best of our week in Napa. The location is close to all the great food and wine locations but far enough away to make it seem like paradise where you are the only person in the world who matters. The rooms are full of natural light, and the beds are feather alternative and provide for the best sleep ever. The bathroom is divided, so the toilet is in a side area with its own door. The view from the bar cannot be beat at sunset, and they even have heaters on the ceiling as needed. If you have the chance to stay at Auberge and don't, you will truly miss out.
reviews.title: Cannot wait to visit again!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in August 2011, and this hotel was amazing. We loved every minute of our stay. Our room was beautiful and spacious, the pool service was top notch with excellent food, we loved our meals at the restaurant on the deck at sunset with the beautiful view.. we have not one complaint about our entire trip. We just had a fabulous weekend together and we feel this hotel was nicer than many of the fancy hotels we've stayed at previously. My husband and I often find ourselves daydreaming about our next trip to Auberge du Soleil, and we've decided to make it an annual anniversary trip for us.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011
reviews.text: We arrived at the auberge with pretty high expectations based on the many things that we had read and heard about it. Sometimes it is hard for a place to live up to it's hype but that wasn't the case here. We loved every minute of being here. We also were fortunate to be here at the beginning of December so we got to see the thanksgiving and Christmas decorations. The staff was great, the room was incredible, the spa was gorgeous and the food was delicious. We will definitely be back.
reviews.title: Auberge exceeded our expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This restaurant came highly recommended by experienced wine county friends - told my husband "you'll be a hero". They were completely correct. This was at the high end of what we had wanted to spend and was the "big dinner" of our all too short trip to the area. Although we found the ordering a tiny bit confusing, the food was fabulous. Not one thing we didn't love. The wine selections were excellent and reasonable (for the type of restaurant). Service was good and the restaurant lovely. We visited in March and so could not enjoy the gardens that are reported to be lovely.
reviews.title: Proved my husband a hero

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've stayed at this resort twice, the first time was magical, we arrived in the late afternoon to a lovely glass of red wine served in a tiny glass, upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite and had the absolute best pool service one could imagine. The staff could not have been nicer. The second visit was not so nice, the room was really small and it felt dated, for the amount of money we spend on the accommodations I was hoping for something better, in their defence maybe we just enjoyed the 1 bedroom suite too much. The tiles in the bathroom were lifting the sink in the drinks alcove was stained - little things. My husband and I were celebrating our 25 year anniversary and I had contacted the Concierge several times regarding turn down etc. We enjoyed a fabulous dinner at Presse Restaurant in Rutherford and returned to our room; no turn down, not fire, nothing. (On top of that the room was cleaned very late in the afternoon, just when we were ready to leave for dinner). We were so disappointed. I called the front desk and they explained that due to a large group they had no time to send someone! Really!!! Several minutes after my phone call an employee arrived with a fire log for the fire place and suggested that we light the fire ourselves and that the matches could be found on the mantle. Yikes. Normally this really wouldn't bother me, but it was a very special occasion . We spent very little time at the resort because the service was just so bad. I wish I could say it wasn't but I just cant.
reviews.title: Not that great second/third time around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next evening we decided to have dinner at the restaurant which had been touted as a must. The food was excellent, the service was not. We were greeted with "what will you have folks" after being advised of the specials. I didn't care for the overfamiliar way in which most of the staff treated us and I assume the rest of the guest. We experienced the same treatment at the pool.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with amazing staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did not write a review because I assumed this was just one of those trips. If something can go wrong it will. My husband and I travel 3 times a year and this trip is always special because its without our kids in the spring. I decided to give this resort another chance for my 50th birthday but will never again.
reviews.title: Wow.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All I can say is this, the reservations agent was agressive, rude and condescending with regards to our reservation. The price quoted was at least $500.00 more that what was advertised on the website and the only response was "well we discussed the rooms options and you were aware of the pricing when we discussed this reservation yesterday'. That may very well be true, BUT why would a reservations agent be schooling a consumer on the fine points of room categories, really at $1,700.00 a night one would think there would be some finesse.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, amazing views, good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have decided on another property in Rutherford who in my opinion can give the Auberge some lessons in customer service. I'm so sorry not to be able to stay there again, but if the staff is snobbier than the guest there's really no choice.
reviews.title: Heavenly stay

description: Auberge Du Soleil is a prestigious luxury resort and spa with a world renowned restaurant nestled within 33 sunlit acres of Rutherford Hill in beautiful Napa Valley, California.• 52 luxurious suites and rooms boasting unsurpassed views of the valley vineyards • Michelin-starred restaurant with bistro and bar overlooking the valley on wrap around decks • Award-winning luxury Spa • Exclusive pool with lounge• Fitness center, open-air movement studio, yoga pavilion and tennis courts• 5 stunning and intimate locations for weddings and events• A comprehensive art collection of outdoor sculpture
